instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.P2V7NAND_EN: What is P2V7NAND_EN? P2V7NAND_EN is a signal that enables the PP2V7_NAND power rail when it is high, which is a power rail necessary to turn on the SSD. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 13" macbook pro touchbar model SSd missing
threads.message: I have a [B]2016 13" macbook pro touchbar model thats does not see the internal ssd. [/B]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 13" macbook pro touchbar model SSd missing
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 13" macbook pro touchbar model SSd missing
threads.message: Might be. I found a pic of the mobo on ebay and the model is on the underside. Is there a know issue with the ssd on this model?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 13" macbook pro touchbar model SSd missing
threads.message:
J9600 is closed?
Any history available?

Boot USB macOS and check if detects internall SSD in Disk Utility.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 13" macbook pro touchbar model SSd missing
threads.message: No it doesnt detect ssd any way I try. no sign of spillage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 13" macbook pro touchbar model SSd missing
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 13" macbook pro touchbar model SSd missing
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 13" macbook pro touchbar model SSd missing
threads.message: Then check all SSD/NAND related voltages...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 13" macbook pro touchbar model SSd missing
threads.message: Seems <SIGNAL>PP1V2_SSD_HOT</SIGNAL> line is short and when I inject 1.2v into L9330 <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> gets hot.  I guess I will start with this ic.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 13" macbook pro touchbar model SSd missing
threads.message:
I replaced <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> now  <SIGNAL>PP1V2_SSD_HOT</SIGNAL> short is gone but only ssd voltages I get is
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_SSD</SIGNAL> 3.3v.
<SIGNAL>STORAGE_LB_EN</SIGNAL>: 3.3V
<SIGNAL>SSD_RESET_LB_L</SIGNAL>: 3.3V
<SIGNAL>LPSR_EN_LB_L</SIGNAL>: 3.3V
<SIGNAL>SSD_BOOT_LB_L</SIGNAL>: 1.7V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 13" macbook pro touchbar model SSd missing
threads.message:
I replaced <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> again and also <CHIP>U9400</CHIP> now getting SSD voltages.
L9320 <SIGNAL>P0V9_REG_SW</SIGNAL>  = .9v
L9321 <SIGNAL>P0V9_REG_SWL</SIGNAL> = .9v
L9300 <SIGNAL>P0V9_FIXED_SWL</SIGNAL> = .9v
<CAPACITOR>C9356</CAPACITOR> <SIGNAL>PP1V2_SD_COLD</SIGNAL> = 1.2v
L9330 <SIGNAL>P1V2_HOT_SW</SIGNAL> = 1.2v
<CAPACITOR>C9335</CAPACITOR> <SIGNAL>P1V2_SSD_HOT</SIGNAL> = 1.2v
L9340 <SIGNAL>P1V8_COLD_SW0</SIGNAL> = 1.8v
L9341 <SIGNAL>P1V8_COLD_SW1</SIGNAL> = 1.8v
<SIGNAL>STORAGE_LB_EN</SIGNAL> = 3.3v
<SIGNAL>SSD_RESET_LB_L</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>SSD_PWR_EN_LB_L</SIGNAL> =  0V
<SIGNAL>LSPR_EN_LB_L</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>SSD_BOOT_LB_L</SIGNAL> = 1.8V
C940 <SIGNAL>PPVIN_2V7_NAND_LB</SIGNAL> = 13V
<CAPACITOR>C9405</CAPACITOR> <SIGNAL>PP3V3_2V7_NAND_VCC</SIGNAL> = 2.7V
<RESISTOR>R9406</RESISTOR> <SIGNAL>PP2V7_NAND_PVCC</SIGNAL> = 5V
<RESISTOR>R9420</RESISTOR> <SIGNAL>P2V7NAND_EN</SIGNAL> = 0V
<CAPACITOR>C9401</CAPACITOR> <SIGNAL>PPVIN_2V7_NAND_LB</SIGNAL> = 13V
 100MHz at <SIGNAL>PCIE_CLK100M_SSD_LB_P</SIGNAL>/N
Any ideas welcome.
Boots but doesnt show ssd even with usb installer.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 13" macbook pro touchbar model SSd missing
threads.message:
"<CAPACITOR>C9405</CAPACITOR> <SIGNAL>PP3V3_2V7_NAND_VCC</SIGNAL> = 2.7V
-----------------------------
<RESISTOR>R9420</RESISTOR> <SIGNAL>P2V7NAND_EN</SIGNAL> = 0V"
This is strange, don't you think?
Enable signal is required first; and should be present, if you get 2V7 output voltage.

Possibly NAND damaged by <CHIP>U9300</CHIP>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 13" macbook pro touchbar model SSd missing
threads.message: Sorry that was a typo. Is there anything else I can check?. Is it possible to replace the nand ?. I dont have donor for this board, possible to buy new nand?. also which ic number do you suspect?.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 13" macbook pro touchbar model SSd missing
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 13" macbook pro touchbar model SSd missing
threads.message:
The NANDs from SSD have specific information.
Maybe not worth to continue with this board.
You can try to replace with chips from donor board...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 13" macbook pro touchbar model SSd missing
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 13" macbook pro touchbar model SSd missing
threads.message: Any chip powered from L9330 can be affected; not an exact way to guess it...
